Bash(claude --print "You are the Developer agent.

**[Developer]**

Your task is to implement GitHub issue #15 \(Feature: Create task\).

## Issue Details
- Title: Feature: Create task
- User Story: As a user, I want to add tasks to a list, So that I can track things I need to do.

## Acceptance Criteria
- POST /api/lists/:listId/tasks endpoint
- Title required, max 64 characters
- Maximum 25 tasks per list enforced
- Task created with isCompleted: false
- Order set to append at end of list
- Input field at bottom of task list
- Enter key submits new task
- Validation error if title too long
- Disabled input + message when 25 tasks reached
- Optimistic update - task appears immediately
- Action added to undo stack

## Technical Notes
- Store: users/{userId}/lists/{listId}/tasks/{taskId}
- Fields: title, isCompleted, order, createdAt, updatedAt
- Order: use max existing order + 1

## Empty State
- ""No tasks yet. Type below to add your first task.""

## Design Specs \(from Designer\)
Reference the detailed design specifications posted as a comment on the issue, following patterns from:
- CreateListForm.tsx - Form structure, validation, keyboard handling  
- EditableTitle.tsx - Character counter styling, error states
- Input component - Base styling, aria attributes

## Instructions
1. First, explore the codebase to understand existing patterns
2. Create the API endpoint for creating tasks
3. Create the frontend components following the design specs
4. Integrate with the list detail page
5. Add proper validation and error handling
6. Implement optimistic updates
7. Run tests: npm test
8. Run lint: npm run lint
9. Create a branch named: 15-create-task
10. Create a PR with title: ""feat: Create task \(#15\)"" and body that includes ""Closes #15""

Use gh pr create to create the PR when done." --allowedTools "Bash,Read,Write,Edit,Glob,Grep")
